documents

In the new system, we need the ability to create
standard documents like emails and faxes. Is there
an easy way to do this using PolicyCenter?

| Documents: definition Gi

* Documents are electronic files that
contain information pertaining to an
account, policy, or job

¢« Documents are not part of the
contractual policy

Question

ae ie at least two examples of how documents might be used in a policy

¢
¢

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer Gi

ae one at least two examples of how documents might be used in a policy

¢
¢

* Track information that documents the assets covered by the policy (i.e.,
photographs of jewelry, diagrams of the workplace floor plan)

¢ Track information used to rate the policy (i.e., assessments from property
inspectors). Record correspondences with the insured

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

,~ — What are the two ways that electronic documents can be added to
Yo PolicyCenter?

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Answer

,~ — What are the two ways that electronic documents can be added to
Yo PolicyCenter?

Documents can be added by:
+ Uploading (linking) to an existing document

+ Creating a new document from a template

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD

Question

,~ — When a document already exists in PolicyCenter and you choose to edit
Yo it, where is the edited copy stored while it is being edited? What must you
do to have the edited copy replace the master copy?

Sooo oooe sooo oOo oOo oAaDS

Gi

Answer Gi

,~ — When a document already exists in PolicyCenter and you choose to edit
Yo it, where is the edited copy stored while it is being edited? What must you
: do to have the edited copy replace the master copy?

The edited copy is stored on your computer. To have it replace the master copy, you
must click the Upload button on the Documents screen.

Sooo ooo ooo Oooo oOoD
